page.title: 15THE GREAT HOUSE BARN
page.content: The visitor centre for the Rivington Country Park is housed in another notable landmark of the area.This is Great House Barn,so called because of the farm nearby.However it is of particular interest because the huge beams inside form a cruck structure which hints at he Anglo-Saxon origin of the barn. Visitors to the Country Park may well gaze up at these as they tour the exhibition at the centre or drink a cup of tea in the cafe area. This is now the nerve centre of the Park.Information is available and a clear indication of how the space is to be used.One can fly model aeroplanes in one section but only walk quietly in another.Probably Lever would have approved the sense of ordered enjoyment and the great old beams now seem safe for years.
